title: CV
text:
Michigan State University East Lansing, Michigan
Research Associate - present
My research will primarily focus on methodology for age-structured stock assessments, with an emphasis on the types of penalized likelihood models currently used in 1836 treaty waters of the Great Lakes and other areas, and comparison of those methods with alternative assessment approaches.

title: About
text:
About
I am a Research Associate (Postdoc) at the Quantitative Fisheries Center (QFC) & Michigan State University. I consider myself a quantitative fisheries ecologist. Some of my research interests and expertise include stock assessment, simulation modeling, fish population dynamics, socio-ecological modeling, management strategy evaluation, and assessment of harvest regulations.
   



  



Background
I received my BSc. in Marine Vertebrate Biology at the State University of New York at Stony Brook in 2016 and my MSc. in International Studies in Aquatic Tropical Ecology at the Universität Bremen in Germany in 2018. I just recently completed my Ph.D. in Fisheries and Aquatic Sciences at the University of Florida in Dr. Ed Camp’s lab in 2023.
